title: Guest Ponders How Long Is Too Long for a Visit

lines.linesSec1: DEAR ABBY: After an invitation to visit, how long can I stay before I'm imposing? -- TOO LONG IN NEW MEXICO.
lines.linesSec2: DEAR TOO LONG: It depends upon the relationship you have with the person who invited you. Usually, when an invitation is extended, it is for a specified time period -- a week, a weekend, etc. Two truisms apply here: Guests, like fish, begin to smell after three days (Benjamin Franklin), and One of the most important things that Hollywood teaches is to always leave your audience hungry for a little more (Howard Bragman). P.S. When in doubt, ask!
